<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 759, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the efficiency of a filament lamp. Fig. 4.1 shows the filament lamp with its glass bulb immersed in water in a beaker.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 114, 834, 308]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 324, 532, 342]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 4.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 355, 576, 373]]<|/det|>
The reading on the thermometer in the water is \(19.0^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 386, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
Only the glass of the lamp is in contact with the water and the electrical connections are completely insulated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 432, 324, 450]]<|/det|>
The lamp is switched on.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 463, 685, 482]]<|/det|>
At the end of the experiment, the temperature of the water is \(21.5^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 495, 146, 513]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 495, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
The mass of the water in the beaker is \(600\mathrm{g}\) and the specific heat capacity of water is \(4200\mathrm{J / (kg^{\circ}C)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 541, 181, 560]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 541, 747, 560]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 680, 920, 699]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 711, 181, 730]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 711, 920, 761]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 772, 725, 791]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 440, 920, 473]]<|/det|>

Every reasonable effort has been made by the publisher (UCLES) to trace copyright holders, but if any items requiring clearance have unwittingly been included, the publisher will be pleased to make amends at the earliest possible opportunity.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 871, 917, 905]]<|/det|>
To avoid the issue of disclosure of answer- related information to candidates, all copyright acknowledgements are reproduced online in the Cambridge Assessment International Education Copyright Acknowledgements Booklet. This is produced for each series of examinations and is freely available to download at www.cambridgeinternational.org after the live examination series.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 913, 917, 938]]<|/det|>
Cambridge Assessment International Education is part of Cambridge Assessment. Cambridge Assessment is the brand name of the University of Cambridge Local Examinations Syndicate (UCLES), which is a department of the University of Cambridge.
